alert.note: Alert for Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 12:30PM EDT until May 09 at 3:12AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following county, Tyler. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1227 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - As of 1215 AM, the Middle Island Creek gauge near Middlebourne was at 16.9 feet. At 16 feet, the field next to gage floods. Low and poor drainage areas along the creek and tributaries. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Middlebourne. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
